chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI 5th offense and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI 5th offense and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Peter R. Falcone was found guilty of OWI 5th offense, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Counseling shall specifically include:  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
* Pay fine of $6400.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May Not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations or disruptive groups.    May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No association with any individuals who use or traffics in controlled substances.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Frank Parise.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.    Defendant is sentenced to 5 years in the WSP forthwith; 2 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years of Extended Supervision.  Credit for 71 days.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program, but is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.    Court imposes a fine of $6400 plus costs and DNA surcharge.  DE also ordered to pay prosecution costs totaling $140.00.  Any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  DE's driving privileges are revoked for 36 months.  AODA Assessment & Ignition Interlock ordered.  Appeal Rights given. Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
